author: Chris Hine
title: Blackhawks lead Islanders in first game at Barclays Center - Chicago Tribune
text:
NEW YORK – Another day, another pre-game ceremony for the Blackhawks. This time, however, they were just witnesses as the Islanders baptize their new home at the Barclays Center in Brooklyn.
On Wednesday, it was the Hawks taking up the pre-game ice time as they raised their 2015 Stanley Cup championship banner.
The Hawks lead the Islanders 1-0 after the first period after Artem Anisimov's first goal as a Hawk. Anisimov's goal came on a nifty play when the Blackhawks were shorthanded. Anisimov stole the puck near the blue line of the Islanders zone, skated in and shot high off his backhand past Islanders goaltender Thomas Greiss.
After Wednesday’s 3-2 loss, coach Joel Quenneville made some changes to his lineup, inserting defenseman Viktor Svedberg into the lineup for David Rundblad and winger Viktor Tikhonov for Kyle Baun.
This is Tikhonov’s first NHL game since 2009, when he played his lone season in the league with the Coyotes.
“Getting a taste of it for one year then having to be away for so long makes you really, really hungry and motivated,” Tikhonov said. “I’m glad to get another crack at it.
Svedberg made his NHL debut.
